metadata.title: CVE-2016-5128 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
objects.cc in Google V8 before 5.2.361.27, as used in Google Chrome before52.0.2743.82, does not prevent API interceptors from modifying a storetarget without setting a property, which allows remote attackers to bypassthe Same Origin Policy via a crafted web site.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5128` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu1.1307
chromium-browser-l10n - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu1.1307
chromium-chromedriver - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu1.1307
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu1.1307
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu1.1307
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu1.1307').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
